meanings.definition: A mass of tissue that grows abnormally and uncontrollably, forming a lump or swelling in the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor found a tumour in her stomach during the check-up.
meanings.sent2: The tumour in his lung was causing him discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The tumour decided to throw a party in her liver, but it got too crowded.
meanings.sent4: The city's pollution problem was like a tumour slowly spreading through its streets.
meanings.sent5: The tumour in the garden grew so large, it overshadowed all the flowers.

meanings.definition: A swelling or enlargement in a part of the body, typically caused by an abnormal growth of cells.
meanings.sent1: She noticed a small tumour on her wrist after the fall.
meanings.sent2: The tumour on his ankle made it difficult for him to walk.
meanings.sent3: The tumour on the tree branch made it look like it had a bump.
meanings.sent4: The corruption in the government was like a tumour eating away at the country.
meanings.sent5: The tumour on the hill grew so big, it changed the landscape.
